data.name: Next Perfect Square and Cubic Integer
data.description:
_Too few people recognize that the high technology so celebrated today is essentially a mathematical technology._ Edsger Dijkstra

EXPLANATIONS

The integers ```64``` and ```729``` have an special property, they are both, perfect squares and cubic. In effect: ``` 8² = 64 and 4³ = 64 27² = 729 and 9³ = 729 ``` The number ```64``` and ```729```are the first values of the sequence of _perfect squares and perfect cubic numbers_. The integer ```1``` will be considered trivial and it will not be counted.

THE TASK

Given an integer, ```N, N > 0```, you have to output the closest perfect square and cubic number but strictly higher than ```N```. The result should be expressed as ```modulo 12345787``` because we have results with many digits. We put some examples of inputs and their corresponding output to understand the features of the function that that you have to create. ``` N (input) result(output) 4 64 5 64 728 729 1000 4096 4096 15625 4000001 4826809 5559917313492231480 12234099 ```

THE TESTS

You have to pass 500 tests and the range for the value of N will be: 2 ≤ N ≤ 1 × 1040 Performace and precision are key factors. Your suggestions, observations and eventual issues wills be welcome. Hope that you can enjoy this easy one.
